newsitem.title: USA: Ford president sees improved '97 sales vs '96.
newsitem.headline: Ford president sees improved '97 sales vs '96.

text.p: Despite rising competitiveness due to an escalation in the dollar-yen exchange rates, Ford Motor Co president Jacques Nasser said he expects Ford to post improved 1997 sales over 1996.

"We've seen Japanese companies become a little more aggressive in the product area and perhaps pricing areas as well, but this is not unexpected," Nasser noted in an interview with Reuters Financial Television (RFTV).
As a counter measure, he said, "If it means trying harder and doing more in other areas of our cost elements, we'll just have to do it."
Commenting on sales prospects for the year, Nasser said, "We had a hot pace (in 1996) but we certainly see improvement overall in 1997."

Ford expects strong growth in Brazil and Argentina and relatively flat growth in Australia this year, Nasser said. "We'll probably have flat growth overall in Europe, with some countries showing a little more growth than others (such as Italy)," he continued.
The biggest challenge for Ford will be "keeping its momentum going on products across thw world and to get back to profitability in the Latin America area and also in Europe." he said.
